meanings.sent1: She used extra glue to reenforce the broken chair leg.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers reenforce the building's foundation with steel beams.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape seemed to reenforce his invincibility.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed reenforced her resolve to overcome any obstacle.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk reenforced the team's confidence before the big game.

meanings.definition: To provide additional support or assistance.
meanings.sent1: The teacher always reenforces her students' learning with extra practice.
meanings.sent2: The safety net was there to reenforce the trapeze artist's performance.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rainstorm reenforced the need for an umbrella.
meanings.sent4: His encouraging words reenforced her belief in herself.
meanings.sent5: The backup generator reenforced the power supply during the blackout.

meanings.definition: To add more force or emphasis to something.
meanings.sent1: The bold font was used to reenforce the important message in the document.
meanings.sent2: The speaker raised her voice to reenforce the urgency of the situation.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient reenforced the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent4: The dramatic music reenforced the emotional impact of the movie scene.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors reenforced the cheerful atmosphere of the party.
